summary:
Swahili, or Kiswahili, is a Bantu language spoken mainly in Tanzania, Kenya, and Mozambique. It's estimated that between 60 to 150 million people speak it. Swahili has borrowed many words from Arabic, and it became a common language in East Africa due to trade with Arab merchants.

Swahili is an official language in the East African Community and is used across the African Great Lakes region. It's also one of the African Union's working languages. The UN even declared a Swahili Language Day to celebrate its growing importance.
title: Swahili language
